intro: Lessingia nana, commonly known as dwarf lessingia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically features a mat-forming growth habit with numerous short, branching stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in late summer to early fall. Lessingia nana is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
